definition: not to be shirked without dishonor (idiom)/incumbent/bounden (duty)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Rong
to hold/to contain/to allow/to tolerate/appearance/look/countenance
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: It is our bounden duty to help the disabled.
sentences.chinese: 帮助残疾人是我们义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: I think it's incumbent upon us to support him.
sentences.chinese: 我变为支持他是我们义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: It is the bound duty of the cultural organizations to fill people's needs for intellectual products.
sentences.chinese: 满足人民群众的精神需要是文化部门义不容辞的义务。

sentences.english: Only when the culture self-consciousness of Mongolian education promoted, could the grassland culture be promoted.
sentences.chinese: 弘扬草原文化是当代蒙古族教育义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: It is incumbent upon the global community to act now.
sentences.chinese: 全球社会义不容辞，现在就应行动起来。

sentences.english: China's constitution stipulates that grown-up children are duty-bound to support their parents.
sentences.chinese: 中国宪法规定赡养父母是成年子女义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: Maintaining world peace is our unshirkable internationalist duty.
sentences.chinese: 维护世界和平是我们义不容辞的国际主义义务。
帮助他人是义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: As a contemporary college students, is duty-bound to develop the national culture.
sentences.chinese: 作为当代大学生，弘扬民族文化更是义不容辞。

sentences.english: Aware resisting "three vulgar", is each citizens bounden responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 自觉抵制“三俗”，是每位公民义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: Protecting the earth our homestead is an unshirkable duty for every earthling .
sentences.chinese: 保护地球家园，是每一位在世者义不容辞的责任。

definition: to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
not to refuse to (idiom)/not to hesitate to
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
ten thousand deaths will not prevent me (idiom); ready to risk life and limb to help out
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
vocation/duty/mission in life
as far as one's capabilities extend (idiom); to the best of one's ability/within one's powers
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
should/ought
lit. seek but fail to get (idiom); fig. exactly what one’s been looking for
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to try one's utmost/to strive
to share tribulations/to help sb with worries and difficulties
